job_tasks.phrase: build and maintain ETL pipelines
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of creating and managing data pipelines, which are essential for data processing and integration within software systems.

job_tasks.phrase: create foundational data models in our data warehouse
job_tasks.justification: Creating data models is a fundamental software engineering task related to structuring and organizing data within a database or data warehouse.

job_tasks.phrase: integrate new data sources using DataOps best practices, including documentation and testing
job_tasks.justification: This directly refers to the integration of new data sources into existing systems, adhering to software development best practices (DataOps, documentation, testing).

job_tasks.phrase: support other data specialists in their work to make their queries and tables efficient and their use of data effective
job_tasks.justification: This involves optimizing existing code and data structures, which falls under software development and maintenance.

job_tasks.phrase: build and maintain data models, libraries and the tooling supporting data processing
job_tasks.justification: This reiterates the core software engineering responsibility of building and maintaining data infrastructure and tools.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members to collect business requirements, define successful outcomes, and design data models
job_tasks.justification: Collecting requirements and designing data models are integral parts of the software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Leverage raw data in our data warehouse to build a curated data models
job_tasks.justification: This is a specific instance of data modeling and structuring, a software engineering task.

job_tasks.phrase: Write production quality ELT code (Python, SQL) with an eye towards performance and maintainability
job_tasks.justification: Writing production-quality code in specific languages (Python, SQL) with a focus on performance and maintainability is a core software engineering activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Create and maintain architecture and systems documentation
job_tasks.justification: Documentation is a crucial part of the software development process, ensuring maintainability and understanding of systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Maintain our data catalog as a scalable resource to support self-service and serve as single source of truth for data definition
job_tasks.justification: Maintaining a data catalog involves managing and structuring data resources, a task aligned with software engineering principles for data management.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide data modeling expertise to all team members through code reviews, pair programming, and training to help deliver optimal, DRY, and scalable database designs and queries
job_tasks.justification: This involves code reviews, training, and ensuring best practices in database design and query optimization, all core software engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: Improve, manage, and teach code maintainability and performance standards in code submitted and reviewed
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on code quality, maintainability, and performance standards is a direct software engineering responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Help our team maintain and improve the infrastructure for data collection, processing, management and analysis
job_tasks.justification: Maintaining and improving data infrastructure is a software engineering task, akin to maintaining the infrastructure for any software system.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, design, implement and drive new solutions and software for solving complex data processing problems across all of DeepL
job_tasks.justification: This is a broad software development task focused on creating new solutions and software to address complex problems.

job_tasks.phrase: Work on our internal tools to make the data easily accessible to our internal stakeholders
job_tasks.justification: Developing and maintaining internal tools to facilitate data access is a software development task.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members to collect business requirements
job_tasks.justification: Collecting business requirements is essential for understanding the business context and aligning technical solutions with business needs.

job_tasks.phrase: gain an analytical understanding of these datasets
job_tasks.justification: Gaining an analytical understanding of datasets is crucial for translating business needs into effective data models and solutions.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with team members to collect business requirements, define successful outcomes, and design data models
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions collaboration with team members.

job_tasks.phrase: Provide data modeling expertise to all team members through code reviews, pair programming, and training
job_tasks.justification: This involves sharing knowledge and expertise with team members through various collaborative methods.

job_tasks.phrase: work in a cross-functional team with product managers, data scientists, data engineers and developers to solve complex technical challenges
job_tasks.justification: This highlights working within a cross-functional team, emphasizing collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up
job_tasks.justification: The mention of an annual learning budget and the statement 'because we never stop learning' directly indicates a focus on continuous learning and professional development.

job_tasks.phrase: If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together.
job_tasks.justification: This encourages candidates to apply even if they don't meet all criteria, emphasizing growth and potential, which aligns with a learning and adaptability mindset.

job_tasks.phrase: Research, design, implement and drive new solutions and software for solving complex data processing problems across all of DeepL
job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'drive new solutions' implies taking initiative and ownership of innovation.

job_tasks.phrase: Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.
job_tasks.justification: Hack Fridays and valuing 'initiatives' and 'creativity' point towards fostering innovation and ownership.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks such as building and maintaining ETL pipelines, creating data models, writing production-quality code (Python, SQL), and managing data infrastructure. There is no mention of Generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering, or specific AI model development. The role is about data engineering and analytics within a software development context, aligning with the 'Software Engineer' profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job description is very clear and detailed regarding the responsibilities and technologies involved. It explicitly describes traditional data engineering and software development tasks without any mention of AI or ML specific tasks, making the classification straightforward.
